bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 7 (Monday, January 13, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. NORMAN:H.R. 5593.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8[Page H208]

item.name: Economic Development, Public Buildings, and Emergency Management Subcommittee

item.title: A bill to amend title 40, United States Code, to modify the definition of Appalachian region.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

item.name: Economic Development, Public Buildings, and Emergency Management Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings, and Emergency Management.
Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

summary.text: This bill modifies the definition of Appalachian region for purposes of the Appalachian Regional Commission to include Union County, South Carolina.

bill.title: To amend title 40, United States Code, to modify the definition of Appalachian region.

item.title: To amend title 40, United States Code, to modify the definition of Appalachian region.
To amend title 40, United States Code, to modify the definition of Appalachian region.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings, and Emergency Management.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
